metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1056 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Out-of-bounds Read error in tiffcrop in libtiff 4.3.0 allows attackers to cause a denial-of-service via a crafted tiff file. For users that compile libtiff from sources, the fix is available with commit 46dc8fcd.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1056` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.3
libtiff-tools - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.3
libtiff5 - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.3
libtiffxx5 - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> the fix for this CVE seems to be the same as the fix for CVE-2022-0891.

criterions.comment: tiff package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.3').
